headline: Howmet favors long-term deals as parts demand grows after US factory fire
summary: (Reuters) -Howmet Aerospace's CEO said on Tuesday the company is prioritizing long-term deals as it sees fresh demand from customers after a major fire at a Philadelphia-area parts factory hit supply, roiling an industry set to make more planes.  Howmet CEO John Plant told Bank of America's Global Industrials Conference that the Pittsburgh-based supplier would invest in expanding capacity for customers that will give it long-term business.  The February fire at SPS Technologies' century-old factory, which produced specialized fasteners for planes, is putting pressure on the industry's already strapped supply chain.
